## Implementation Summary

- Created .env.local.example with env var placeholders for Convex, Clerk, and OpenAI
- Created convex/schema.ts with 4-table schema

notes:
## Implementation Summary

### What was done
- Configured Tailwind v4 bookish theme in globals.css using @theme inline block
- Added Libre Baskerville font (400, 700 weights) via next/font/google
- Created parchment palette (10 shades: cream to deep brown)
- Created ink palette (10 shades: light to near-black for text)
- Added verdict semantic colors matching schema enum values
- Set base body styles (parchment-50 bg, ink-900 text)

### Key decisions
- Used Tailwind v4 CSS-first @theme config instead of tailwind.config.ts (aligns with Tailwind v4 patterns)
- Parchment palette is warm/amber-toned to evoke a bookish feel
- Ink palette is warm-gray (not pure gray) to complement parchment
- Verdict colors are strong and accessible: green/amber/red/gray

### Files modified
- src/app/globals.css (modified — added full theme)
- src/app/layout.tsx (modified — added Libre Baskerville font)

### Caveats
- No dark mode support yet — can be added later if needed
- Components should use font-serif for headings, font-sans (default) for body text
